text: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/en/docs/hubl/hubl-supported-functions> Yo, this page is on the default theme for some reason
<https://status.HubSpot.com/>
Oh
Oh dear

so we are still having issues with clients and their root domains, now we have a client ready for migration but they want to continue using their non-www URL...they googled the issue and found this which tells them we can ask HS to "un-gate their portal IP addresses," anyone know if this is something that can actually be done?
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Tickets-Conversations/Is-it-possible-to-remove-the-www-from-the-front-of-my-domain/m-p/196146/highlight/true#M58>
We do offer an apex redirection service which will send visitor to a subdomain, but content can not be hosted on the apex domain.
Domain hosts can also often handle the apex domain redirection

yeah, the issue is the client will not believe anything our SEO team says explaining how (when done properly) this will not affect their SEO rankings and is now insisting that we get the IP address from HubSpot to continue moving forward with the non www.

on a separate note: we also have a client who's previous site was "<https://rootdomain.com>" and their Google links are no longer working after migration since GoDaddy can only fwd from "<http://rootdomain.com>" to "<https://www.rootdomain.com>"
would the apex redirection service work for this 2nd example?
if so, how do we get access to that service?
Unfortunately we can not handle secure apex domain requests. If you required that, you would need to acquire a cert for <https://rootdomain.com/> and host it somewhere, and handle that redirect
yeah, that is what we have been telling clients...so just to confirm: there is no way to obtain or request from y'all (HubSpot) to have the IP address for a client portal to be provided/un-gated?
I recommend using <https://www.easyredir.com/>
HubSpot stopped using A records years ago.
There is a free version of that service as well.
Thanks <@U38EZFVFE> the only option HS has given us is a paid redir service and most client don't want to purchase an additional service
<https://www.easyredir.com/free-url-redirection/>
<@U6W3H6YN8> would still like a solid yes/no to the client's ungating questions so we can let them know
We can give you IPs to redirect the apex domain (not secure). There is no way to host content on the apex domain

I would say NO. I have been working with HS since 2010 and since they switched to using CNAMES they have NEVER given us an A record to use in plac eof the cname. only for forwarding . FYI the HubSpot forwarding IP doesnt forward SSL enabled domains. This is a limitation of the tool. That is why I recoment easy redirect

this client is being pretty adamant about it and has delayed migration go live so I guess the next step is for us to get those IPs for the redirect... <@U6W3H6YN8> whom do I need to contact to obtain those?
If you call support they can help you out otherwise I can do it. Just dont have time at the moment, looking into the issues we are having. Sorry
Can do, the client said they tried and nobody could help them
Once again to clarify, content cannot be hosted on the apex. This is just to redirect the apex to a subdomain, and will not work with secure apex requests
